alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 4:14PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oklahoma, southwestern Lincoln and northwestern Pottawatomie Counties through 500 PM CST... At 414 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Midwest City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Oklahoma City, Midwest City, Del City, Choctaw, Harrah, McLoud, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park, Wellston, Warwick, Tinker Air Force Base and Forest Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 157 and 165. Interstate 44 between mile markers 154 and 158. Interstate 240 between mile markers 11 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
